citation.article-title: Zhongshania antarctica gen. nov., sp. nov. and Zhongshania guokunii sp. nov., gammaproteobacteria respectively isolated from coastal attached (fast) ice and surface seawater of the Antarctic
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Zhongshania guokunii sp. nov.
Zhongshania guokunii (guo.ku′ni.i. N.L. gen. masc. n. guokunii of Guo Kun, named after Guo Kun, who made a significant contribution to the Chinese Antarctic expedition).
Description is as for the genus plus the following characteristics.
Cell are straight rods, 0.4–0.5 µm in diameter and 0.8–1.5 µm long.
Colonies grown on marine agar at 30 °C for 7 days are white, circular (0.5−1.2 mm in diameter) and convex with smooth surfaces.
Grows at 4−35 °C (optimum at 30 °C), but not at or above 37 °C.
Grows in 0−7.5 % NaCl (w/v, optimum at 2.5−3.5 %) and at pH 5.5–9.0 (optimum at pH 6.5–7.5).
Hydrolyses Tween 40 (weakly) but not starch, Tween 80 or DNA.

Able to utilize fructose, glycerol, mannitol, pyruvate and Tweens 40 and 80 as sole carbon and energy sources but not glucose, sucrose, maltose, mannose, lactose, xylose, raffinose, trehalose, arabinose, cellobiose, N-acetylglucosamine, acetate or citrate.

In API 20NE tests, positive for nitrate reduction and assimilation of mannitol, but negative for indole production, hydrolysis of aesculin, arginine dihydrolase, gelatinase, urease, β-galactosidase, acid production from glucose and assimilation of arabinose, glucose, mannose, maltose, gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid, malic acid, citrate, phenylacetic acid and N-acetylglucosamine.
The predominant cellular fatty acids of the type strain are C17 : 1ω8c, summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C17 : 0, C15 : 0 and C18 : 1ω7c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 51.8 mol%.
The type strain is ZS6-22T ( = KACC 14532T = CCTCC AB 209247T), isolated from Antarctic coastal surface seawater.
